intro: Allostelites arvensis, commonly known as the field alstromeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers, which consist of a central disk surrounded by ray florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Allostelites arvensis is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to environmental stress.
